intro: Chondrilla setulosa, commonly known as the hairy chondrilla, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are hairy and often have a rough texture, while its yellow flowers are small and clustered. Chondrilla setulosa is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought conditions.
